p: We used iPlate (Hangzhou Sovell Technology Development Company Limited), a research and development solution for dietary management, which provides an open platform supporting Chinese nutrient research [ 17]. A standard iPlate set comprises 3 components: 3 types of plates embedded with RFID chips, which provided information such as what kinds of foods were on the plate and their corresponding weights; a production bench, which can erase and rewrite the RFID chips embedded in the plates, and a settlement bench, with an RFID reading function.
